result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count 2, with credit for 6 days time served.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: If revoked court grants huber for work.

miscConds.notes: *   Restitution is set at $1622.00 payable to Milwaukee Area Domestic Control Division.

*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of probation or a civil judgment be entered.
*   DNA sample to be taken and assessment to be paid by the end of probation or a civil judgment be entered.

*   No illegal drugs to be maintained by random drug screens.
*   No contact or possession of any animal.
*   Court ordered the Defendant to not own, possess, or train any animal for 5 years.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: received on behalf of the defendant; received and filed. nm
Amended order modifying report date; received and filed. nm

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Court has received papers regarding additional medical information relating to the Defendant. Court extends report in date to the House of Correction to 01-04-2017 by 5:00pm.
Order signed and filed. nm
reflects 11-22-16 Court order changing report date to 11-29-2016 at 5 pm

NOW THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED THAT: The defendant shall report to the House of Correction by 5:00 pm on November 29,2016 to serve his sentence. 
SIGNED AND FILED.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, with credit for 6 days time served. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years. If revoked court grants huber for work.

CONDITION TIME AS TO COUNT 1:
As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days, concurrent with count 2, with huber for work. Court STAYED and ordered defendant to report to the House of Correction on 11-22-2016 by 5:00 pm. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, with credit for 6 days time served. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years. If revoked court grants huber for work.

CONDITION TIME AS TO COUNT 2:
As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days, concurrent with count 1, with huber for work. Court STAYED and ordered defendant to report to the House of Correction on 11-22-2016 by 5:00 pm. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.    
     *   No illegal drugs to be maintained by random drug screens.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact or possession of any animal.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of 
          probation or a civil judgment be entered.
     *   DNA sample to be taken and assessment to be paid by
          the end of probation or a civil judgment be entered.
     *   Restitution is set at $1622.00 payable to Milwaukee Area 
          Domestic Control Division.

Court ordered the Defendant to not own, possess, or train any animal for 5 years.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights,
Sentencing Referral Form,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.
Letters on behalf of the defendant; received and filed.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Gary Rosenthal advised the clerk that he wouldn't be available until after 2:30 pm today.  ADA Kristin Schrank was not available after 3:00 pm today.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
in support of defendant, filed.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and of maximum penalties, waived all rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by state and defense to complaint as factual basis to sustain plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense made a motion to withdraw at the request of the defendant.  The defendant advised the Court that he was not requesting new counsel.  The defendant requested an adjournment of the trial due to medical and financial issues.  Court denied defense motion for an adjournment.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 24, 206 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Status conference held off the record.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests more time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elizabeth A. Carlson informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 4/13/2016. Court vacates the jury trial scheduled for 4/13/2016.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Conference held in chambers - off the record.  For reasons stated on the record, this judge recused herself from this case.   Judge recused self.  Case reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION ON MAY 21, 2015.  CASE RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 5, 2015 AT 8:30 AM.  PLEASE NOTIFY YOUR CLIENT OF THE CHANGE.  IF THIS DATE IS INCONVENIENT, PLEASE CONTACT THE CLERK AT 414-278-4775 TO RESCHEDULE.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Carlson is ill and unable to be here at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is not to own any pets  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnnie Lee Anderson in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/15 @ 1:30 pm
